intro: Draba asprella var. zionensis, commonly known as Zion's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in the Zion National Park area. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and has a low, mat-forming growth habit. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and appear in early spring. It is adapted to harsh, arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
